rules.title: Present tense
rules.abstract: The simple present tense keeps the actor and action clear. The simple present tense in technical content indicates established facts and knowledge.

rule.rule-statement: Use the simple present tense for a prescribed action, regardless of when it happens.
rule.justification: The reader encounters the instruction as they work on the process described.

ul.li: <rule-statement>Include white spaces outside of inline elements.</rule-statement>
<rule-statement>Use the entity for non-breaking spaces ( ) for spaces before or after punctuation.</rule-statement>
<rule-statement>Include punctuation in block elements, not inline elements.</rule-statement>

rule.rule-statement: Use the simple present tense for statements of fact.

ul.li: <stepresult>The link resolves according to the processing rules.</stepresult>
<info>A broken link leads to a page with an error message.</info>

rule.rule-statement: Use the simple present tense to explain graphical presentations of data, such as tables and figures.
